summary: This is an email from an FBI agent forwarding multiple subpoenas issued to telecommunications companies and financial institutions as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The subpoenas were issued between December 2018 and June 2019 to obtain records.

persons.name: I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email forwarding subpoenas related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena to Oath Holdings (Yahoo)
events.description: A subpoena was issued to Oath Holdings (Yahoo) as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena to Verizon
events.description: A subpoena was issued to Verizon for records.

events.title: Multiple Subpoenas Issued
events.description: Subpoenas were issued to AT&T, Century Link, and T-Mobile on this date.

events.title: Subpoenas to AT&T and Verizon
events.description: Subpoenas were issued to AT&T Southeast, AT&T, and Verizon.

events.title: Subpoena to T-Mobile
events.description: A subpoena was issued to T-Mobile.

events.title: Subpoena to Gold Coast Federal Credit Union
events.description: A subpoena was issued to Gold Coast Federal Credit Union, likely for financial records.

events.title: Subpoena to Amazon
events.description: A subpoena was issued to Amazon.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively issuing subpoenas to major telecommunications companies (AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile, Century Link) and internet companies (Yahoo, Amazon) in 2018-2019 as part of the Epstein investigation.
A subpoena was issued to Gold Coast Federal Credit Union on June 14, 2019, indicating investigators were seeking financial records.
The email shows coordinated investigative efforts across multiple companies to obtain records relevant to the case.
The document demonstrates the scope of the investigation, targeting communication and financial data.
The correspondence date is July 24, 2019, shortly before Epstein's death in August 2019.
